> @danny0405 @LinMingQiang Would #5884 be helpful here?

I'm afraid not, The current issue problem is that the network is unavailable and cannot be retried
@hudi-bot run azure

also have the same error when using spark SQL to create a hudi table.
```
create table if not exists hudi_table5(
  id int, 
  name string, 
  price double
) using hudi
options (
  type = 'cow'
);
```

spark SQL error:

@xushiyan: @rmehlitz has been out of office for a while, will be back soon. Unfortunately I have no time to reproduce the experiments at the moment, but we will be on it again soon!
@nsivabalan @xushiyan - @jdiebold is out of office for a while, will try to get to #5715 (with @rmehlitz) first, asap (currently a bit short of time)
Gentle ping @codope, could you plz review this again?

@loveShyBoy Are you using any particular [index type](https://hudi.apache.org/docs/configurations/#indextype) ? Can you share all your write configs?
cc @danny0405 @yuzhaojing

@kazdy Isn't it same as HUDI-4276?
cc @xiarixiaoyao
@XuQianJin-Stars @leesf Should hudi CTAS command assert for empty path in this case?
Closing the issue as there is a tracking jira matching priority with fix version 0.12.0
Closing it as it's resolved with HMS mode. Also, this shouldn't be relevant as we upgrade to Hive 3 in 0.12.0
Lowering the priority as there is a workaround but we should check whether there are any leaky connections with timeline server. cc @yihua

Should be resolved by https://github.com/apache/hudi/pull/5882
@Humphrey0822 Can you try out that patch?
@hudi-bot run azure

@codope it's related because it also calls for automatic schema evolution with similar logic.
With MERGE INTO new fields are being dropped, so once [HUDI-4276](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HUDI-4276) is done it can be used in MERGE INTO I guess?

Looking at `MergeIntoHoodieTableCommand` I think the target table schema is always applied on write, so whatever new column was added (in source table but not in target table), it's just being dropped from source DF.
Because of this line:
`HoodieWriteConfig.WRITE_SCHEMA.key -> getTableSchema.toString`
where getTableSchema returns target table schema.
Rsolved as per https://github.com/apache/hudi/issues/5728#issuecomment-1146071893. Please reopen if you still face some issue.
邮件已收到！谢谢！                       薛超

@ganczarek Can you please try latest Hudi (0.11.1)? There were a couple of fixes in the lock provider. See https://github.com/apache/hudi/pull/5255
https://github.com/apache/hudi/pull/5380

> @xushiyan Thanks for the help! please close this issue.
> 
> one thing I am still not clear is why build with spark3.2 does not work, readme did not mention anything specific
> 
> Heng

I would suggest to open a new issue for run_sync_tool with Spark 3.2. We have tested the tool with Spark 3.2 before 0.11.0 release. Please open another issue and we can try to reproduce and see what's missing. Thanks.

@yanmushi let us know about below

> Did you use the bundle jar with hive profile packaged ?
@eric9204 v0.11.1 is released now. Can you please try again? If you still face the issue, please open a JIRA and share the ticket here.
@amit-ranjan-de Did you get a chance to talk to aws-support or try out with the patch that Siva suggested above?
Closing as there is a patch under review.
@nsivabalan @pratyakshsharma is there any followup on this issue?

@yangdafish As suggested above, could you please upgrade to latest Hudi release 0.11.1 and see if issue is still there?
@YuweiXiao if you can share the patch which fixed this issue, that would be great.
@nleena123 Any udpate on this? Is this still an issue?
@melin Did you get a chance to try out the above suggestion by @leesf ?
@xiarixiaoyao Any followup on this issue?
Closing it as a user environment-specific issue. Please repoen if the issue persists.
Closing it due to inactivity. The recommendation here is to upgrade to latest Hudi. Please reopen if the issue is still there after upgrade.
@yihua Can you please followup on this issue?
@parisni From your last comment looks like it worked on your end. Please reopen if the issue still persists.
@kazdy Any udpate from aws-support?
@p-powell Just an update. There were a couple of fixes in the write path to improve performance. Can you please try out the latest master or release(0.11.1)?
Unfortunately not, closed the case as they couldn't replicate this.
@vinothchandar please review this. The case when `cdc.supplemental.logging` is false and SparkSQL syntax may be supported in the subsequent commits or the other pr.

@codope Thanks for the review. I reran the integration testing,  there's one single test failed but it seems not related to this change. Can you also take a look? Thanks
Hi @codope , we're upgrading to `0.11.0` 😃

> @loveShyBoy Are you using any particular [index type](https://hudi.apache.org/docs/configurations/#indextype) ? Can you share all your write configs? cc @danny0405 @yuzhaojing

delta streamer used default index type , flink also used hoodie.index.type=BLOOM
0.10.1 do not have index.type config ,  exists since 0.11.0

`--hoodie.table.name=tablename_hudi
--table.type=COPY_ON_WRITE
--hoodie.datasource.write.recordkey.field=primary_id
--write.precombine.field=update_time
--hoodie.datasource.write.partitionpath.field=dt
--hive_sync.db=ods
--write.tasks=4
--hoodie.datasource.write.keygenerator.type=SIMPLE
--write.bucket_assign.tasks=6
--max.poll.records=100
--max.partition.fetch.bytes=524288
--hoodie.datasource.write.hive_style_partitioning=true
--index.bootstrap.enabled=false
--write.index_bootstrap.tasks=6
--index.state.ttl=0.2
--prop:hoodie.index.type=BLOOM`


in 0.10.1 flink used default index type is HoodieIndex.IndexType.INMEMORY，so i changed to BLOOM. but the doc say Bloom is default . I'm a little confused。that is right?

`
  public static final ConfigProperty<String> INDEX_TYPE = ConfigProperty
      .key("hoodie.index.type")
      .noDefaultValue()
      .withDocumentation("Type of index to use. Default is Bloom filter. "
          + "Possible options are [BLOOM | GLOBAL_BLOOM |SIMPLE | GLOBAL_SIMPLE | INMEMORY | HBASE | BUCKET]. "
          + "Bloom filters removes the dependency on a external system "
          + "and is stored in the footer of the Parquet Data Files");

private String getDefaultIndexType(EngineType engineType) {
      switch (engineType) {
        case SPARK:
          return HoodieIndex.IndexType.SIMPLE.name();
        case FLINK:
        case JAVA:
          return HoodieIndex.IndexType.INMEMORY.name();
        default:
          throw new HoodieNotSupportedException("Unsupported engine " + engineType);
      }
    }`

> @YuweiXiao The root cause is that AVRO serializes Decimal type to bytes. However, for DECIMAL(10,4), Spark writes as int64.
> 
> ```
> message spark_schema {
>   optional int64 id (DECIMAL(10,4));
> }
> ```
> 
> For more details, see [sksamuel/avro4s#271](https://github.com/sksamuel/avro4s/issues/271).

Yes, disabling vectorized read is a workaround. What do you think about the solution I mentioned above, i.e., auto-disable vectorization and respect user-defined configs.
I found out the issue is caused by after changing the table to spark data source table, the table SerDeInfo is missing. I creates a pull request.

@codope @alexeykudinkin Hi, could you plz review this also? Like https://github.com/apache/hudi/pull/5723, this fixes COW tables, also add some tests for the usages of `DataSourceReadOptions.READ_PATHS`

I suppose to align with Spark. Consider the situation that a hudi table has two sources: Flink for real-time and Spark for batch-backfill, Flink has already aligned decimal type with Spark (see HUDI-3096) . Therefore, when writtern by Spark avro, decimal with a precision smaller than 18 is recommendded to int64/32. cc @xiarixiaoyao
